question: What are some of your favorite things?

answers.answer: Meryl Streep because she's amazing and so insanely talented.
LAUNDRY! Takes me a whole week from washing to folding and putting it all away.
Brad Pitt. Super talented and super gorgeous.
Football. Weird, since I was a cheerleader, but I secretly hated the games.
Ramen, sushi, pizza and poke bowls.
Friends. It's classic, funny, and uplifting and relatable.
Snowboarding, wake surfing, weight lifting, running, spin, Crossfit, yoga and pilates.
I thoroughly dislike going grocery shopping – it's stressful. So many options.
This is Us. I love television shows and movies that are heart-felt.
J.K. Rowling because she invented Harry Potter. I'm a nerd.
Halloween. I love dressing up. I like creepy/scary stuff.
Meryl Streep. Because Meryl Streep.
New Year's Eve – new beginnings and lots of champagne.
Game of Thrones, even though I'm often confused.
Shark Tank. I don't know why, it's just intriguing.
Halloween – you should see my closet. It's packed with over 50 costumes. I wish every day were Halloween.

question: if you could be a fictional character, who would you be and why?

answers.answer: Wonder Woman! She has it all: strength, class, beauty and confidence!
Ariel because she's a beautiful mermaid that can sing and gets to marry Prince Eric, what a stud.
Any Disney character that has a happily ever after with a prince. Or Leela from Futurama because she is a badass and Fry loves her to the moon and back.
Samantha from Bewitched because I could make anything happen that I wanted.
A gorgeous, badass woman who saves the world!
Lola Bunny. She's good at sports and keeps up with the boys.
James Kirk from Star Trek because I'd love to explore crazy worlds.
Elsa, because I've always wanted to be a Disney princess.
Or Willy Wonka. The man had his own chocolate factory!
Olivia Pope because she's a badass.

question: What are your top all-time favorite movies?

answers.answer: Sister Act 2, Gladiator, Pitch Perfect
Crazy, Stupid, Love, The Count of Monte Cristo, Breakfast at Tiffany's
Sixteen Candles, Princess Bride, Taken
Crazy, Stupid, Love, 21 Jump Street, Stand by Me
The Little Mermaid, Pretty Woman, and The Great Gatsby.
Beetlejuice, Dark Shadows, Practical Magic.
The Sandlot, The Sound of Music, any of the classic '80s horror movies, like Nightmare on Elm Street.
Love and Basketball, Forrest Gump, and Mean Girls.

question: What's your guilty pleasure?

answers.answer: Binge-watching reality TV and eating bags of popcorn in place of meals.
Popping pimples. I know, gross!
Chocolate milkshakes.
Sweet tooth!
Sundays lying in bed all day, watching reality TV and eating pizza.
Botched and Real Housewives.
Eating full meals in bed. Like putting a legit body towel over me and ordering pizza – no plates needed.

question: what does being married mean to you?

answers.answer: Commitment and being your whole, true, imperfect self with someone. You both accept each other – flaws and all!
A partnership, a best friend, someone who makes you your best self, who will be a great parent and someone who will always be there for you through thick and thin.
Everything. It's extremely important to me and my life would be complete with being married with a family.
It means waking up next to your best friend forever. It means never quitting. It means never being too old to be silly or dance in the rain.
Creating our own world. Creating our own values and goals. Becoming better people together. Respect, admiration, protection.
At a young age, I witnessed true love through my parents. That's what I want.
Lifelong commitment, passion, happiness, best friend.

question: what are five things you can't live without?

answers.answer: Tracee Ellis Ross or Miley Cyrus or Chrissy Teigen because they are all so fierce and confident and are not afraid to be themselves and speak their minds.
My family, friends, Spotify, hair straightener and cute clothes.
Chapstick, facial lotion, bobby pins, popcorn, and stamps.
Reading, family, love, curiosity and cheese.
Mama, my nephews, porch swings, mascara and love.
Yoga mat, passport, lip gloss, sunglasses and the ocean.

question: if you could be any animal, which one and why?

answers.answer: A free orca. I'd love to live in the ocean and they move around, plus they keep their fam tight.
Bat – flying mammal! My sister said my spirit animal was a bat because I see beauty in dark things.
Unicorn because those who believe in magic will find it.
An otter because everyone loves you and you just swim around and cuddle all day. Goals.
Leopard – sly, quick, sassy, beautiful.

question: what's the most embarrassing thing you listen to?

answers.answer: Nickelback
Country (when I'm feeling sad) or the Sister Act 2 soundtrack, which I don't think is embarrassing at all, but my friends disagree.
"Everything is Awesome" from The Lego Movie.
I do BLAST Celine Dion in the car and put on a good concert by myself.
T-Swift (so basic).

question: If you could have lunch with three people, alive or dead, who would it be and why?

answers.answer: Kim Kardashian, Steve Jobs, and my grandpa.
Barack Obama, my grandma (miss her so much), Audrey Hepburn. I'd order a round of shots!
Whitney Houston, Bernie Sanders and Beyonce.
Vince Vaughn, Betty White, and Ryan Reynolds. It would be a blast of a lunch and we'd pretend it was Betty's birthday at a Hibachi restaurant!
David Foster Wallace, Julius Caesar (with translator) and Thomas Jefferson. Antipasta and cocktails.

question: what are you most afraid of?

answers.answer: Losing my support system or being trapped in an unfulfilling life.
Picking the wrong person to marry.
Unused potential.
Losing one of my family members.
Unfulfilled potential

question: What are your three best attributes?

answers.answer: Funny, kind, down to earth
Loyal, honest, charismatic
Passionate, funny, unwaveringly loyal
I'm very open-minded, loyal and fun to be around.
Loyal, honest, good listener.

question: What's the most outrageous thing you have ever done?

answers.answer: Hold a HUGE python in Thailand. I hate snakes so this was crazy for me. I wanted to feel like Britney Spears at the VMAs, I did not.
Breaking my wrist on a mechanical bull was pretty memorable.
I once drove a car off of a ramp and through the caboose of a moving train. No lie.
Skydiving and applying to be on a reality TV show where millions of people will judge you - no pressure!

question: what is your greatest achievement to date?

answers.answer: Starting my business over when I moved back to Denver and making it successful in a short amount of time with no money for marketing or advertising.
Putting myself together after heartache and winning an Emmy!
Finding my purpose as a health and fitness coach. I LOVE what I do for work.
Buying my first house in downtown Nashville before I turned 25.

question: Do you have any fears?

answers.answer: Sharks!
No dogs yet. I'm waiting for someone to co-parent a dog with! I do have a plant, his name is Phil.
Sharks and spiders are NOT my jam.
Don't make me swim in the deep ocean. There is so much that we don't know about the deep sea… I don't want to get eaten.

question: What is your biggest date fear?

answers.answer: That we will run out of things to talk about and not mesh well together or having food stuck in my teeth.
Dead silence.
Awkward silence.
Bad conversation and awkward, no sense of humor, food in my teeth.

question: what are the top three things on your bucket list?

answers.answer: Hot-air ballooning, grape stomping, fall in love and own a house and dog with my partner.
See the Northern Lights. Attend a game seven (NBA or MLB)! Hot air balloon over Napa Valley.
Riding an elephant, skydiving, and cliff-jumping. Adventures, baby!
Visit Japan and go to a Hedgehog café, go scuba diving by a shipwreck, hang out with pigs in the Bahamas.

question: what is your highest athletic achievement?

answers.answer: I received an invite to nationals for rock climbing and placed third on the west coast in my division.
Rookie of the Year as a Miami Dolphins cheerleader and being co-captain of the team.
Second Degree Black Belt in Tae Kwon Do.
Participation trophies.

question: What city is the most romantic to you, and why?

answers.answer: I love N.Y.C. Something about it is so romantic – gets me every time!
New York City! That's where my parents met.
Take this girl to France! It's where all the love stories seem to be based in the fairytales I heard as a little girl.
Paris. Obvi

question: where do you see yourself in five years?

answers.answer: Teaching art or owning an art studio for children, hopefully married and planning to have babies!
I would love to see myself married, open up my own wine and tapas bar, and working towards having a child.
Hopefully married with two corgis.

question: If you could be someone else for just one day, who would it be and why?

answers.answer: An NFL player. I would have been a great football player, QB or receiver.
Oprah, because I would love to get inside her head and see what it was that made her become so successful.
Literally anyone in Taylor Swift's girl squad.

question: if you won the lottery, what would you do with your winnings?

answers.answer: Pay off my student loans and my parents' houses, and buy a cute little house and travel.
Buy a penthouse in Soho, build a wild animal conservation in Africa/India, have a pet cheetah.
Buy each of my family members their dream homes and then travel the world and do philanthropic work.

question: what hair color do you secretly love to have?

answers.answer: I'm pretty into the redhead from Riverdale.
Purple!! I've considered a very light lilac because I love it so much!
Silver

question: who do you admire most in the world and why?

answers.answer: My dad. He's incredibly wise and confident, he loves his family and wife more than anything, and he knows what he wants and goes for it.
My family as a unit. Full of life, creativity, intellect, drive, passion.
My mother. Having a child at a young age and continuing her education as a nurse is not an easy task. She made me into the woman I have become today.

question: What competitive sports did you play?

answers.answer: I was a competitive dancer growing up.
I played soccer and field hockey in grade school.

question: if you could be any animal, which one would you be?

answers.answer: An elephant. They are incredibly intelligent, loyal, and just beautiful creatures.
Dog. I want to be spoiled and loved unconditionally.

question: do you consider yourself a romantic?

answers.answer: I'm definitely a romantic. I am impressed by the smallest romantic gestures.
Yes, because no matter how much I've been hurt, I always give love another chance.

question: where do you meet guys?

answers.answer: I don't... jk. The past two I've met have been through dating apps and they're terrible human beings.
Online dating apps, which is why I'm still single.

question: would you consider yourself a lover of art?

answers.answer: I would! But I'm not an expert.
Yes. Wish I could be art.

question: do you like being the center of attention or do you prefer being more mysterious and why?

answers.answer: Center of attention. I like to talk, interact with and get to know everyone at once.
I enjoy being mysterious. People always make incorrect assumptions about me and I'd rather they not have me confirm those.

question: describe your idea of the ultimate date?

answers.answer: My ultimate date involves good conversation, laughter, kissing and wine.
A rooftop dinner overlooking an amazing view like the ocean.

question: if you could be any fruit or vegetable, which one would you be?

answers.answer: I would be a pineapple, standing tall, wearing a crown and sweet on the inside.
Avocado - it's the perfect food.

question: are you a little bit country or more of a city person?

answers.answer: Both! I was born in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, but I also love the glitz and glam lifestyle of L.A.
City 100 percent, even though I'm from Texas.

question: What's your favorite flower?

answers.answer: Sunflower! They are drawn to the light, vibrant, colorful, strong and long lasting!
Sunflowers, because I don't think I could go past a field of them without smiling!

question: What's your favorite book and why?

answers.answer: Year of Yes by Shonda Rhimes. She is a role model and I love to live life with a "YES" perspective!
50 Shades of Grey

question: what does your ideal mate look like?

answers.answer: Tall, easy smile, can survive a zombie apocalypse-type body.
Mmm…. Ryan Gosling.

question: what is a typical saturday night like for you?

answers.answer: Dinner out with friends or home relaxing alone with my puppies.
I typically work Saturday nights, but I'd love to dress up in a killer outfit, head to downtown Nashville, bar hop with friends and take lots of crazy photos.

question: how good of a cook are you?

answers.answer: Thebomb.com
I cook all the time and my mom is a chef, so I would say I'm pretty good.

question: if you could break any law, with no repercussions, which law, and why?

answers.answer: I wish I could drive as fast as I want.
Speeding when I'm late. I'm always late.

question: if you wanted to really impress a man, what would you do and why?

answers.answer: Just let him know I like him. I'm over games.
Be myself. Only way someone can like the real you.

question: would you consider yourself neat or messy?

answers.answer: Messy, but not horrifically so.
I wish I could say neat, it's my life long goal! …. Messy :).
